attributes.action: RAAC Homeowners Justice: National Fund, Legislative Reform & Public Inquiry Now!
attributes.additional_details: We think many face bankruptcy and homelessness after RAAC was found in ex-council homes sold under right-to-buy. We seek a national fund and public inquiry into government and council decisions on RAAC. We want laws to protect homebuyers, including a high-risk building register, mandatory issue reporting by surveyors and solicitors, and developer accountability for defects, allowing homeowners to make claims for up to 60 years. We think mortgage interest charges should be banned on no-owner-fault condemned properties, and first-time buyer status restored for affected owners.
attributes.background:
Support RAAC communities facing homelessness and bankruptcy by:
Establishing a national fund to aid affected homeowners and tenants
Launching a public inquiry into council and housing association practices on RAAC
Bringing in protective legislation

departments.name: Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government

other_parliamentary_business.body:
Several small changes were made to the petition text on Monday 23 December 2024. These were needed because of a publication error. The text that is now available is the correct text for the petition.
Apologies for any inconvenience. If you'd like to remove your signature from the petition, you can email us at petitionscommitteeprivacy@parliament.uk.
other_parliamentary_business.subject: Change to petition text
